title: Claims Technical Application Specialist Senior
requirement: Claims Technical Application Specialist Senior(Job Number: 431484) We're looking for big ideas-ideas that can embrace multiple petabytes of vital information. That's how much data we manage and store at Kaiser Permanente. We're home to some other big ideas, like creating KP HealthConnect, the nation's largest electronic medical record system, using social media and text messaging to help members engage in their own care, and developing predictive modeling tools that anticipate health issues before they're an issue. It's the kind of thinking that's shaping the future of technology, health care, and the lives of all of our members. If you're ready to contribute your own big ideas, join us. Description NOTE: This opening is a Temporary full-time employee role, for 2 years with benefits. Responsible to interface with the client, analyze business needs, determine business solutions and implement appropriate system configurations and changes to applications/software. Essential Functions: â€¢ Responsible for researching and troubleshooting software and workflow issues to understand software build steps needed for production environment of business application. â€¢ Configures application based on analysis and collaborations to create builds. â€¢ Researches application issues, performs root cause analysis, present findings and recommendations. â€¢ Identifies areas for work flow and process improvements. Vets ideas with team and works through applications improvements to implement. â€¢ Analysis: Responsible for analysis of complex business requirements, systems upgrades, workflows and application capabilities. Utilizes analysis to collaborate with users, analysts and consultants to determine solutions and required configurations to met business requirements. â€¢ Testing: Tests application configurations and builds or does unit testing in non-production environment and reports on outcomes noting issues. Corrects issues found in testing. â€¢ Change Management: Change request management including cost estimation, project documentation and user training. â€¢ Implementations: Works collaboratively with implementation teams to ensure process design, interface development, testing and implementation and user training are performed to quality standards. May perform some project management activities in the development and implementation of systems changes. Prepares builds for implementation into production. Trains on application functions, changes, and improvements. Plans and communicates project implementations. Monitors implementations into production, makes adjustments, as necessary. Monitors cues of tasks to trend tasks for issues discrepancies, analyzes and implements solutions. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum five (5) years of professional experience in all aspects of the primary product, program or technology. Education â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ N/A Preferred Qualifications: â€¢ The Claims and Remittance Application Coordination Specialist position will be supporting major claims initiatives in NCAL . Candidate should have a proven ability to work well with both technical and business resources. â€¢ Candidate will play a critical role in gap analysis, development of innovative solutions, and ensuring system and workflow efficiencies. Candidate should have strong communication and analytical skills. â€¢ Prior experience with EPIC Professional and Hospital Claims and Remittance functionality and/or knowledge of industry standard EDI transactions (837, 999, 277, 835) is Preferred as well as EPIC Certifications . â€¢ Responsible to interface with the client, analyze business needs, determine business solutions and implement appropriate system configurations and changes to applications/software Primary Location: California-Pleasanton-Pleasanton Tech Cntr Building F 5810 Owens Dr. Scheduled Hours (1-40): 40 Shift: Day Working Days: Monday - Friday Working Hours Start: 8:00 AM Working Hours End: 5:00 PM Schedule: Full-time Job Type: Standard Employee Status: Temporary Employee Group (Union Affiliation): Salaried, Non-Union, Exempt Job Level: Individual Contributor Job: Information Technology Public Department Name: Resolute Back Office - Claims Travel: Yes, 5 % of the Time Job Eligible for Benefits: Yes External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. title: Sr Consulting Data Analyst
requirement: Sr Consulting Data Analyst(Job Number: 448207) Working for an organization with the size and resources of Kaiser Permanente Northern California means having the potential to positively affect the health and well-being of entire communities. From our financial, business, and IT experts, to our RNs, allied health professionals, and physicians, we work together to provide the best care experience to our members and the communities we serve. As one of the most diverse regions in the country, Northern California offers everything from the majestic Sierra Mountains, to breathtaking Yosemite, to world-renowned Napa Valley. Here, you'll discover the cultural and recreational diversity that makes Northern California one of the most desirable places in the world to live and work. As Northern California's largest health plan, Kaiser Permanente provides you with the resources and opportunity to build a rewarding career in an environment that supports your success. Join us. Description Under general supervision, this position exists to assist the organization in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing, and reporting data. This position functions both as a senior analyst and as a high-level statistical analytics programmer. Essential Functions: â€¢ Designs and enhances databases. â€¢ Designs effective and user-friendly menu systems. â€¢ Develops accurate, easy to read, and useful information reports. â€¢ Designs and generates tracking and monitoring tools. â€¢ Participates in the development of outcomes and process measures, including technical specifications to enable population measurement, guideline implementation, and evaluation. â€¢ Tests complex statistical routines using macros, vendor software, and software written by self and others. â€¢ Tests and maintains data integrity. â€¢ May assist with sophisticated statistical models and forecasting tools using these databases. â€¢ Assists with the definition of complex multi-dimensional healthcare issues and develops time tables/processes for decision making. â€¢ May translate needs, issues, and ideas into effective strategies and action plans. â€¢ May formulate specific implementation plans and evaluates the effectiveness of actions/programs implemented. â€¢ Develops creative alternative solutions. â€¢ May assist in the determination of goals and priorities with team, clients, or project management sponsors. â€¢ May communicate results/recommendations to project sponsors, clients, and various senior level audiences (including physicians for TPMG departments). Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Three (3) years of programming in SAS, SQL, VBA, net, or equivalent statistical analytical programming language. â€¢ Minimum two (2) or more years of related analytical consulting experience. Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree in economics, finance, health care administration, public health administration, statistics, mathematics, operations research, or related field required OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. Licenses, Certifications, Registrations â€¢ N/A. Additional Requirements: â€¢ Experience mainframe operating systems. â€¢ Microsoft Office skills required. â€¢ Strong analytic and critical thinking skills, writing skills, communication skills, consulting skills, and ability to work within a team. â€¢ Ability to express complex analytical and technical information to senior management or to audiences with clinical training. â€¢ Must be an independent self-starter. â€¢ Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment. Preferred Qualifications: â€¢ Analytical consulting experience in the healthcare field preferred. â€¢ Experience with MVS/TSO operating systems preferred. â€¢ Experience with analytical manipulation and interpretation of large databases preferred. â€¢ Project management experience preferred. â€¢ Master's degree preferred. â€¢ Broad familiarity with medical practices, especially population management and process and outcomes measurement preferred. â€¢ Knowledge of JCL strongly preferred. Manage data extraction, analytics including complex biostatistical modeling for ongoing diabetes related studies. Research topics may include the following areas: organizational theory and behavior in health care systems, health services research focused on complex and/or chronic illnesses/diseases/disorders. Studies focused on patients with chronic illnesses and the prevention of chronic illness, such as improving cardiovascular disease risk factors in diabetes patients and other cardiovascular disease patients Primary Location: California-Oakland-2000 Broadway 2000 Broadway Scheduled Hours (1-40): 40 Shift: Day Working Days: Mon - Fri Working Hours Start: 8:00 AM Working Hours End: 5:00 PM Schedule: Full-time Job Type: Standard Employee Status: Regular Employee Group (Union Affiliation): Salaried, Non-Union, Exempt Job Level: Individual Contributor Job: Information Technology Public Department Name: Division of Research Travel: No Job Eligible for Benefits: Yes External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Consulting experience leveraging quality control analytics and continuous improvement on process and standardization is highly desired. Intake estimates of new work and resource utilization, deliverable tracking, risk and issue management along with forecasts and tracking to budget. A secondary focus of the successful candidate will be to provide operational support in Release Planning, overall project planning and improve existing operational processes within the QA/Testing space; utilizing industry standard continuous improvement techniques. Monitor and track performance according to contractual obligations and total performance standards. â€¢Efficienciesâ€“ Ownership and accountability to institutionalize domain best practice across the pharmacy testing group and align with Testing Center of Excellence best practices in the effort to maximize reuse, cost savings, efficiencies supporting a One KP Practice. Â· Evaluates business cases for vendor requirements. Â· Accountable for coordination of collection and validation of business requirements. Â· Manages coordination across multiple stakeholders from both IT and Business to ensure project objectives are met. requirement: SSD Sr Health Care Systems Spe(Job Number: 479269) Working for an organization with the size and resources of Kaiser Permanente Southern California means having the potential to positively affect the health and well-being of entire communities. That`s because each of us-from our finance, business, and IT experts to our RNs, allied health professionals, and physicians-shares a commitment to providing the best possible care experience. One of the most diverse regions in the country, Southern California offers everything from quaint coastal communities to bustling urban cities, high desert plains to snowy mountain peaks. Here, you`ll find the cultural, lifestyle, and recreational amenities to complement your work and your life. Come discover the resources, support, and opportunity you need to build the career you`ve always wanted. Description Works independently with various levels of clients within the organization and with outside parties to identify operational business requirements with sufficient detail and clarity to allow IT solution proposal development. Integrates clinical systems into business operations. Proposes and identifies workflow/gap analysis solutions between business and systems functionality. Leads independent initiatives from information gathering and analysis, documentation, and the presentation of findings, into implementation and support. Essential Functions: â€¢ Assist with application technical and operational knowledge in the analysis of client requirements in project areas such as: â€¢ IT testing and product acceptance, gap analysis, development of new business operating models with innovative approaches to IT solutions support and available product functionality, operational readiness assessment, and others. â€¢ Assesses training modality & content for upcoming new functionality releases. â€¢ Assist & facilitate in cross functional task forces to identify and document functional requirements, workflow, information sources and distribution paths, and system specifications. â€¢ Conducts analysis of client business processes and functional requirements and prepares appropriate documentation to communicate and validate the information. â€¢ Analyzes and defines efficient, cost effective solutions which support client business processes and functional requirements. â€¢ Assist in the development of comprehensive business cases with cost, service, and benefit dimensions of proposed IT projects that are used at various levels for funding and scope decisions. â€¢ Supports the implementation of initiatives into deployment using project management methodologies. â€¢ Serve as a single point of contact for the resolution of client issues and acts as a liaison between business clients and IT technical staff. â€¢ Perform systems configuration work. â€¢ Perform predetermined work in system as defined by policy and procedure/protocol. â€¢ Formal presentation to audiences of various levels. â€¢ Evaluate existing application products which could address client requirements and develop recommendations where appropriate. â€¢ Develops test & activation support plans and works with client to perform risk assessment. â€¢ Leads the coordination of solution development and supports implementation of initiatives into deployment using project management methodologies. â€¢ Functions as a subject matter expert and can offer guidance and lend expertise to management and other team members. â€¢ Completes administrative requirements in an accurate and timely manner (e.g. time reporting, status reporting, etc.). â€¢ Travel may be required. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum four (4) years of experience in information systems analysis or implementation or Healthcare operations (Master's Degree in related field (see Education/License/Certification) can be used in lieu of one (1) year of experience). Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree in healthcare, information systems, computer science, engineering or related fields OR four (4) years of directly related experience required. â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ Certification of Epic Proficiency or Epic Certification within twelve (12) months of hire. Additional Requirements: â€¢ Strong skills in critical thinking and analysis, meeting facilitation, verbal and written communications, and interpersonal interactions (e.g., partnering, conflict management, consulting, etc.). â€¢ Proficient with PC applications including database, spreadsheet, word processing, presentation software and graphics packages. â€¢ Travel may be required. â€¢ Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment. Preferred Qualifications: â€¢ Master's degree in healthcare, information systems, computer science, engineering or related fields OR six (6) years of directly related experience preferred. â€¢ Knowledge in health care, clinical systems, information systems, or other related field. â€¢ Prior progressively more complex responsibilities and accountabilities in a large mainframe or client server environment. Primary Location: California-Pasadena-West Annex - Parsons 74 N. Pasadena Ave. Scheduled Hours (1-40): 40 Shift: Day Working Days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Working Hours Start: 8:00 AM Working Hours End: 5:00 PM Schedule: Full-time Job Type: Standard Employee Status: Regular Employee Group (Union Affiliation): Salaried, Non-Union, Exempt Job Level: Individual Contributor Job: Information Technology Public Department Name: SSD Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time Job Eligible for Benefits: Yes External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. title: Care Delivery Informatics & Epic Support Specialist
requirement: Care Delivery Informatics & Epic Support Specialist(Job Number: 491102) At Kaiser Permanente Northwest, the work you do every day supports the health of our members. That`s because each of us-from our financial, business, and IT experts, to our RNs, allied health professionals, and physicians-shares a commitment to providing the best possible care experience. Widely regarded as a mecca for outdoor enthusiasts, the Pacific Northwest blends urban bustle with open space in a way that is sure to enhance your own state of well-being. Looking to build a rewarding career in an environment that supports your success? Join us and put your beliefs into practice. Description This position reports to the CDIS Implementation Manager. The mission of Care Delivery Informatics and Support is to equip our customers with the technology tools they need to improve quality, safety and accuracy to better provide flawless health care and total satisfaction to our customers and members. The department does this through diligent and conscientious attention to user needs, through partnerships with National and Epic Systems in the continued development and enhancement of the system, through partnerships in the Region with NWP, IT, and the Labor Management Partnership, and by applying medical informatics, systems, and project management expertise in improvement efforts across the Region. Care Delivery Informatics and Support supports the region's key strategic initiatives by providing skill assessments and training services to patient care and business process teams. This team plays an integral role in the facilitation, introduction, acceptance, integration, and effective use of KP HealthConnect and related new processes, work flows and new hire training. Essential Functions: â€¢ Analyze complex situations in medical or business office environment to determine opportunities for increasing end user efficiencies with KPHC or other technology solutions (including virtual visits), provide consulting support and take action including: Analyze departmental and individual workflows relating to KPHC. Identify "pain-points" with existing processes where efficiencies are lost. Optimize departmental and individual workflows relating to KPHC. Develop curricula for and conduct departmental and individual training sessions. Facilitate Ambassador Sessions. Develop SmartTools within KPHC. Develop Job Aids for KPHC activities. Provide front-line training support during implementation of new initiatives. Resource for KPHC specific governance groups, Communities of Interest (COI) and special projects including (but not limited to): Clinical content groups. Department of Medical Informatics clinician groups. Health Plan management users of KPHC (from Assistant Department Administrator to Department Administrator). â€¢ Project Management of initiatives designed to expand modalities of care to our members. Possess demonstrated project management skills with little to no oversight and sustainable results with proven outcomes (project scoping, planning, approach design, resource definition, time management, project control, task development). Plan project for optimal results and speed. Transfers knowledge and skills to project team and client personnel. Establish processes and create effective project management tools. May supervise up to 3 projects at the same time. â€¢ Provide intra-department (within CDIS) Support including (but not limited to): Develop StoryBoards for KPHC training. Develop and conduct classroom training sessions pertaining to KPHC expertise. Project support to Support, Technology and Training teams. Review of KPHC Release Notes for major or minor upgrades. May direct the work of others in this role. â€¢ Develop and maintain knowledge of medical and business office processes and workflows. â€¢ As required: Provide support to Care Delivery web projects: Single point of contact for web-project intake. Consultation on the best solution (wiki, SharePoint, Intranet, Internet sites). Customer relationship management between delivery organization and requester. May direct the work of others in this role. With prior coordination provide onsite or phone support to KPHC operational users, working days, evenings, and nights, as needed. May direct the work of others in this role. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum four (4) years of experience of combined adult training/IT support experience preferably in a health care setting. Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ KP Health Connect proficiency or EPIC Certification obtained within one (1) year. Additional Requirements: â€¢ Knowledge of health care and medical terminology. â€¢ Working knowledge of computer systems, PC fundamentals and application software. â€¢ Thorough knowledge of at least two of the following: â€¢ Training of adult learners, preferably in support of automated systems. â€¢ Principles of personal computer architecture, operating systems, and network. â€¢ The work and work flow issues in a clinical or business office setting. â€¢ Demonstrated team player. â€¢ Self-directed learner comfortable with a constantly evolving environment. â€¢ Demonstrated self-motivation skills and aptitude to direct and assist others in a learning or support setting. â€¢ Accomplished interpersonal oral and written communications skills. â€¢ Ability to write quality, concise, non-technical documentation of a technical subject matter. â€¢ Demonstrated organization skills; able to manage multiple priorities and projects concurrently. â€¢ Informatics in use of e-mail and office suite type applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access). â€¢ Demonstrated ability to learn computer applications from a business perspective to help others transfer learning from training back on the job. â€¢ Demonstrated ability to learn new skills quickly and apply them. â€¢ Demonstrated ability to trouble-shoot basic personal computer/printer problems. â€¢ Excellent problem solving and analytical skills-with a focus on root cause and resolution. â€¢ Skilled in facilitation, presentation development and delivery using multiple formats. Preferred Qualifications: â€¢ Recent clinical or systems experience. â€¢ Recent experience in a computer training or support role. â€¢ Experience with implementation and project management for a large-scale clinical systems deployment. â€¢ Experience in gathering user requirements for technology needs. â€¢ Bachelor's degree in health care or information technology field. â€¢ Minimum one (1) KP Health Connect Proficiency or Epic Certification(s). â€¢ PMP Certification or equivalent work experience. Primary Location: Oregon-Portland-Nicolai Service Center 2850 NW Nicolai Ave. Scheduled Hours (1-40): 40 Shift: Day Working Days: Mon - Fri Working Hours Start: Variable Working Hours End: Variable Schedule: Full-time Job Type: Standard Employee Status: Regular Employee Group (Union Affiliation): Salaried, Non-Union, Exempt Job Level: Individual Contributor Job: Information Technology Public Department Name: Care Delivery Onsite Optimization Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time Job Eligible for Benefits: Yes External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Qualified applicants with arrest and/or conviction records will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with Federal, state and local laws, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran, or disability status.

title: Sr Data Consultant
requirement: Sr Data Consultant(Job Number: 494730) Working for an organization with the size and resources of Kaiser Permanente Northern California means having the potential to positively affect the health and well-being of entire communities. From our financial, business, and IT experts, to our RNs, allied health professionals, and physicians, we work together to provide the best care experience to our members and the communities we serve. As one of the most diverse regions in the country, Northern California offers everything from the majestic Sierra Mountains, to breathtaking Yosemite, to world-renowned Napa Valley. Here, you'll discover the cultural and recreational diversity that makes Northern California one of the most desirable places in the world to live and work. As Northern California's largest health plan, Kaiser Permanente provides you with the resources and opportunity to build a rewarding career in an environment that supports your success. Join us. Description Under general supervision, this position exists to assist the organization in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data. This position takes an active leadership role both as a consultant and as a high-level statistical analytics programmer. Essential Functions: â€¢ Leads, makes significant contributions, &/or provides technical leadership to high visibility projects to identify & resolve issues of strategic importance to the organization. â€¢ Interfaces regularly w/ Sr Mgmt to produce timely & valuable results. â€¢ Directs the development of outcomes & process measures, including technical specifications, to enable population measurement, guideline implementation, & evaluation. â€¢ Builds & maintains complex statistical routines using macros, vendor software, & software written by self & others. â€¢ Tests & maintains data integrity across multiple databases (internal SAS, DB2, VSAM; external: Adobe, Excel, SAS parsing routines, COBOL). â€¢ Builds sophisticated statistical models & forecasting tools using these databases. â€¢ Designs & enhances databases. â€¢ Designs menu systems that are effective & user-friendly. â€¢ Develops reports w/ accurate, easy to read, useful information that satisfies the client's needs. â€¢ Designs & generates tracking & monitoring tools. â€¢ Designs research plans for data gathering & analysis; participates significantly in interpreting analyses & developing action plans accordingly. â€¢ Defines & frames complex multi-dimensional healthcare issues & develops time tables/processes for decision making. â€¢ Translates needs, issues, & ideas into effective strategies & action plans. â€¢ Formulates specific implementation plans & evaluates the effectiveness of actions/programs implemented. Develops creative alternative solutions. â€¢ Works closely w/ IT & outside partners (& physicians for TPMG Depts). â€¢ Sets the strategic direction of projects. â€¢ Determines goals & priorities w/ team, clients, or project Mgmt sponsors (when appropriate). â€¢ May coordinate team/project activities & schedules. â€¢ May establish team membership & project participants, provide leadership to multi-disciplinary project teams, as well as manage work of outside consultants when used. â€¢ Communicates results/recommendations to project sponsors, clients, & various Sr level audiences (including physicians for TPMG Depts). â€¢ May participate in the development & Mgmt of the Dept, including coaching & recruiting for consultants/analysts & other departmental activities. â€¢ KP conducts compensation reviews of positions on a routine basis. At any time, KP reserves the right to reevaluate & change job descriptions, or to change such positions from salaried to hourly pay status. Such changes are generally implemented only after notice is given to affected employees. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum five (5) years of programming in SAS, SQL, VBA, .net or equivalent statistical analytical programming language. â€¢ Minimum five (5) years of related analytical consulting experience. Education â€¢ Master's degree in economics, finance, health care administration, public health administration, statistics, mathematics, operations research, or related field required, or equivalent bachelor's degree and two (2) years additional work experience in lieu of a master's degree. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ N/A Additional Requirements: â€¢ Experience with analytical manipulation and interpretation of large databases. â€¢ Experience with MVS/TSO operating systems. â€¢ Exceptional analytic and critical thinking skills, writing skills, communication skills, consulting skills, and ability to work within a team. â€¢ Ability to express complex analytical and technical information to senior management or to audiences with clinical training. â€¢ Proven leadership in consulting and, for some areas, project management. Must exhibit efficiency, collaboration, candor, openness, and results orientation. â€¢ Broad familiarity with medical practices, especially population management and process and outcomes measurement. â€¢ Must be an independent self-starter. â€¢ Microsoft Office skills required. â€¢ Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment. Preferred Qualifications: â€¢ Knowledge of JCL strongly preferred. Expert knowledge of SAS for management of data extraction, statistical analysis (including complex biostatistical modeling for substance abuse research team) and analytical methods documentation. Ability to summarize data modeling outcomes and draft analytical methods sections for both sponsored project applications and scientific manuscripts. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, ability to thrive in a team environment. Research topics include: substance use and mental health research; health services research, quality of care and care delivery, intervention effectiveness and randomized interventions for complex patients with multiple, co-occurring chronic conditions. Writing sample, SAS skills test, and code sample will be required. Primary Location: California-Oakland-2000 Broadway 2000 Broadway Scheduled Hours (1-40): 40 Shift: Day Working Days: Mon - Fri Working Hours Start: 8:00 AM Working Hours End: 5:00 PM Schedule: Full-time Job Type: Standard Employee Status: Regular Employee Group (Union Affiliation): Salaried, Non-Union, Exempt Job Level: Individual Contributor Job: Information Technology Public Department Name: Division of Research Travel: No Job Eligible for Benefits: Yes External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Qualified applicants with arrest and/or conviction records will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with Federal, state and local laws, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran, or disability status.

Description At approximately $48 billion in revenues, Kaiser Foundation Health Plan and Hospitals (KFHP/H) is America's largest not-for-profit health maintenance organization. Named after Henry Kaiser, the company has grown from a 12-bed hospital into an integrated health delivery system serving 9 million members in 9 states and the District of Columbia. Care to Kaiser Permanente health plan members is provided primarily through Kaiser owned and operated hospitals (37), medical clinics, and over 16,000 physicians who are partners or employees of the Permanente Medical Groups. There are some 170,000 employees nationwide. Kaiser Permanente is nationally and internationally recognized for providing innovative, high quality, coordinated, evidence based health care. A significant volume of services in several regions is also provided through contracted networks of community hospitals, physicians, and other providers. title: Lead Business Ops Analyst - Software Asset Management
requirement: Lead Business Ops Analyst - Software Asset Management(Job Number: 489594) We're looking for big ideas-ideas that can embrace multiple petabytes of vital information. That's how much data we manage and store at Kaiser Permanente. We're home to some other big ideas, like creating KP HealthConnect, the nation's largest electronic medical record system, using social media and text messaging to help members engage in their own care, and developing predictive modeling tools that anticipate health issues before they're an issue. It's the kind of thinking that's shaping the future of technology, health care, and the lives of all of our members. If you're ready to contribute your own big ideas, join us. Description Software Asset Management (SAM) is an integral part of the IT Asset Management (ITAM) organization within the Infrastructure Management Group at KPIT. ITAM is responsible for managing both hardware and software assets owned/ leased by Kaiser Permanente. Software assets include both ISV-owned off-the-shelf products and home-grown applications at Kaiser Permanente. ITAM has launched a multi-year foundational program to implement foundational capabilities for SAM across the organization. The program has defined "To-Be" SAM processes based on best practices and created a roadmap for solution implementation by 1H2014. Started in 2014, the program is expected to incrementally roll-out the SAM capabilities across the organization to deliver business value to the business owners/consumers of software asset data. The Business Operations Analyst â€“ Lead will be responsible for reviewing the design and implementing the SAM processes organization-wide, to effectively manage software assets across the lifecycle, which includes acquisition, policy definition, software tagging, discovery, compliance monitoring, maintenance/ chargeback support and retirement of software assets. This role will include day-to-day operational responsibilities relating to software management with the goal of ensuring quality, integrity and usability of software data and contracts within the asset management system. In this capacity, this individual will work with the necessary stakeholders, both internal and external, to ensure that necessary processes are being followed and software asset information is being updated into the asset repository in a timely manner. Essential Functions: Implement and extend the processes for SAM within KP and deliver value added services to ITAM customers by supporting compliance reporting, license management, software reclaim and reuse, internal audit of software, procurement planning and forecasting, long-range planning and budgeting, etc. Work with cross-organizational stakeholders to promote adoption of the SAM processes and technologies to ensure quality, accuracy and usability of software data within the asset management system Review and confirm interpretation of the licensing terms and conditions with contract owners within the Supplier Management Office and implement necessary capabilities to track and report on contract compliance Support compliance reporting which is presented to IT executives and leadership on a periodic basis and facilitate necessary corrective actions across the organization Implement capabilities, policies, processes and technologies to support external organizations with procurement, use, distribution, renewal and retirement of all software licenses and registrations Develop and implement processes to actively track license usage and proactively report licensing trends to technology owners and facilitate timely decisions; identify savings opportunities related to renewals, software licensing, and services and partner with appropriate stakeholders to realize benefits Participate in day-to-day operations and provide on-going technical/functional guidance to the software team for effective license administration and management across the lifecycle; ensure stakeholder satisfaction Mature and extend SAM processes (e.g., software tagging, receiving, media library, etc.) across the enterprise for both COTS and internally developed software Expand list of titles to cover 90% - 95% of software spend from a compliance reporting perspective and other titles that, regardless of spend, could result in risk exposure Implement tools and processes for SAM Maintain the software service catalog to include relevant titles that can be requested by end-users Implement software tagging concepts Develop/deploy compliance reporting for executive management Collaborate across cross-functional teams responsible for cross-team collaboration to mitigate any and all compliance and exposure risks Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum eight (8) years of related experience. Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree in related field, OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ N/A Additional Requirements: â€¢ Thorough knowledge of policies, practices and systems. â€¢ Regularly contributes to the development of new concepts, techniques, and standards. â€¢ Considered functional expert in field within KP. â€¢ Frequently contributes to the development of new theories and methods. â€¢ Employs expertise as a generalist or specialist. Preferred Qualifications: Considered functional expert in field within Kaiser Permanente Progressive IT experience in roles of increasing responsibility relating to software asset management Prior hands-on experience in implementing scalable SAM technologies and processes to discover, track and manage software licensing across large enterprises with independently operating business units Proven ability to balance execution of the strategic vision through leadership and delegation, with a willingness and competence to dive into the technical details as required Strong team leader and experience in working with senior IT executives and negotiating commitments to achieve long-term partnerships to promote software compliance and management across large organizations Recent industry experience in software asset management with primary responsibility for license tracking, and compliance monitoring Strong team player with great interpersonal skills, willing to partner and engage with the Business Operations leadership to deliver substantive, business value-add to the operations Collaborative style and ability to influence at all levels of the organization through large group presentations, as well as individual and small group communications; ability to gain confidence and support of customers and team members In-depth knowledge of licensing models, SAM concepts and industry trends Familiarity with IAITAM/ITIL/COBIT frameworks and best practices Demonstrated ability to achieve project and performance outcomes through others Professional certifications in IAITAM/ITIL/COBIT frameworks or SAM Experience in health plan systems is desired Project/Program management experience and/or certifications Primary Location: California-Pleasanton-Pleasanton Tech Cntr Building B 4480 Hacienda Dr. Scheduled Hours (1-40): 40 Shift: Day Working Days: Mon-Fri Working Hours Start: 8:00 Am Working Hours End: 5:00 PM Schedule: Full-time Job Type: Standard Employee Status: Regular Employee Group (Union Affiliation): Salaried, Non-Union, Exempt Job Level: Team Leader/Supervisor Job: Information Technology Public Department Name: IMG BSMS IT Asset Management Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time Job Eligible for Benefits: Yes External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. title: Data Analyst
requirement: Data Analyst(Job Number: 460921) Working for an organization with the size and resources of Kaiser Permanente Northern California means having the potential to positively affect the health and well-being of entire communities. From our financial, business, and IT experts, to our RNs, allied health professionals, and physicians, we work together to provide the best care experience to our members and the communities we serve. As one of the most diverse regions in the country, Northern California offers everything from the majestic Sierra Mountains, to breathtaking Yosemite, to world-renowned Napa Valley. Here, you'll discover the cultural and recreational diversity that makes Northern California one of the most desirable places in the world to live and work. As Northern California's largest health plan, Kaiser Permanente provides you with the resources and opportunity to build a rewarding career in an environment that supports your success. Join us. Description Under close supervision, this position exists to assist the organization in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data. This position functions both as an analyst and as a statistical analytics programmer. Essential Functions: â€¢ Designs and enhances databases. â€¢ Designs menu systems that are effective and user-friendly. â€¢ Develops reports with accurate, easy to read, useful information. â€¢ Designs and generates tracking and monitoring tools. â€¢ Participates in the development of outcomes and process measures, including technical specifications, to enable population measurement, guideline implementation, and evaluation. â€¢ Maintains complex statistical routines using macros, vendor software, and software written by self and others. â€¢ Tests and maintains data integrity. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum one (1) year of programming in SAS, SQL, VBA; net or equivalent statistical analytical programming language. Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree in economics, finance, health care administration, public health administration, statistics, mathematics, operations research, or related field required OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. Licenses, Certifications, Registrations â€¢ N/A. Additional Requirements: â€¢ Microsoft Office skills required. â€¢ Strong ability to apply analytic and critical thinking skills, writing skills, communication skills, consulting skills, and ability to work within a team. â€¢ Must be an independent self-starter. â€¢ Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment. Description COMPANY PROFILE With a proud history of more than six decades, Kaiser Permanente is the countryâ€™s largest not-for-profit health maintenance organization with over $40 billion in annual revenue. Founded in 1945, the company has grown from a 12-bed hospital into a leading integrated health delivery system that serves nearly 9 million members in nine states and the District of Columbia. Today, Kaiser Permanente is nationally and internationally recognized for providing innovative, high-quality, evidence-based healthcare through the advantages of its integrated insurance and care delivery infrastructure. More than 160,000 healthcare professionals, nurses and physicians serve the healthcare needs of members and communities in eight Kaiser Permanente Regions covering Northern California, Southern California, Colorado, Georgia, Hawaii, Ohio, Northwest (Oregon and Washington), and Mid-Atlantic States (Maryland, Virginia, and the District of Columbia). Kaiser Permanente health plan members receive their care primarily through Kaiser Permanente-owned and operated hospitals and medical clinics, which are staffed by approximately 14,000 physicians of the Permanente Medical Groups. To augment our coverage, we provide some of our services through contracted networks of community hospitals, physicians and other providers. Our eight Regions are comprised of separate but closely cooperating organizations: Â§ Kaiser Foundation Health Plans (KFHP): A non-profit, public-benefit corporation that contracts with individuals and groups to provide HMO and other health benefit plans. KFHP contracts with Kaiser Foundation Hospitals and the Permanente Medical Groups to provide services. Â§ Kaiser Foundation Hospitals (KFH): A non-profit, public-benefit corporation that owns and operates hospitals in California, Oregon, and Hawaii; owns outpatient facilities in all states where they do business; provides or arranges hospital services; and sponsors charitable, educational and research activities. Â§ Permanente Medical Groups (PMG): Partnerships or professional corporations of physicians, with one in each Kaiser Permanente Region. The PMG is responsible for providing and arranging all medical care and services in each of our Regions. Kaiser Permanente has a long-standing and strong commitment to its employees and to organized labor. We also have a unique National Labor-Management Partnership that includes eight international union partners and 30 local union partners representing more than 70,000 KP employees. The Labor-Management Partnership provides an opportunity for the unions and Kaiser Permanente management to unite around common purposes and work together to deliver high-quality medical care in an increasingly competitive healthcare environment. Leveraging its integrated care delivery system, new tools and technology, Kaiser Permanente is taking preventive, proactive, and chronic care to a new level, resulting in better care, better health and more convenient access at an affordable cost. Description The Incident Handler provides investigative and technical forensics skills to determine the extent of a breach, appropriate data collection and preservation, remediation requirements, and security improvement plans. In some cases the Incident Handler will provide chain of custody service for non-technical investigations (e.g., employee situations, fraud, etc.). The Incident Handler may work with both the Cyber Risk Defense Center as well as Special Investigations, National Compliance, Privacy and Security Officers, and Human Resources depending on the type of incident. Essential Functions â€¢ Evaluates process anomalies for security exposure. Identify attack vectors, exploits, malicious code or social engineering attempts. â€¢ Determines scope of breach or exposure, and business risk or impact to the affected business unit. â€¢ Performs root cause analysis, develops remediation plans, and works with SMEs to ensure proper execution of corrective action plans. â€¢ Works with SMEs to determine mitigation strategies, and coordinates with affected business unit(s) to implement mitigating security controls. â€¢ Collects and preserves digital evidence in a forensically sound manner using state-of-the-art forensics tools. â€¢ Broad and extensive knowledge of digital processing platforms, hardware, operating systems, and applications. Ability to identify and troubleshoot failures in any of these areas. â€¢ Strong knowledge and experience in security controls including forensics tools such as; Encase Enterprise, anti-virus, intrusion prevention, authentication mechanisms, and data collection and analysis tools. â€¢ Excellent communication and documentation skills. Ability to produce reports for senior level management that properly articulates risk, exposure, and corrective action plans. Ability to speak publicly and lead diverse teams of SMEs and Operations Management through a security incident. Properly and thoroughly document incident findings, evidence, root cause analysis, and corrective action plans. â€¢ Input to security infrastructure design based on incident response experience. Provides routine updates to Security Policies and Procedures. â€¢ Engages appropriate levels of management to affect improvements to the security posture of the organization. â€¢ Ability to respond quickly and accurately to any level of security incident. Ensure that investigation activities do not interfere with production. Description The scope of the Programming/Analysis family includes development and production support responsibilities. Work is typically centered on enhancements to the existing application/system and responding to user/client problems and issues with the application/system. Work categories for this role include designing solutions, estimating requirements, analyzing efficiencies, performing coding, may conduct and support functional testing, debugging, documentation, scheduling/managing new program releases and/or updates, configuring/deploying the program/application/system update for implementation and ongoing maintenance (database development, job scheduling, network support, responding to client/user requests and issues). title: Configuration Analyst II
requirement: Configuration Analyst II(Job Number: 482363) No matter what your job title, the work you do at Kaiser Permanente supports the health and well-being of the millions of men, women, and children who turn to us for care. That`s because all of us-from our talented corporate and business professionals to our care delivery experts who meet the needs of our members every day-are committed to providing the best possible care experience. With locations across the United States, we offer the opportunity to build a rewarding career in an environment that supports your success. Join us and put your beliefs into practice. Description The HPSC Configuration Analyst (CA) is responsible for Analysis, Design, Build and Unit Testing of Provider Contracts and Benefits within the KPCC Platform, to ensure accurate and timely claims payment consistent with the Regional and National artifacts (e.g. contractual arrangement(s) made with the Providers, Employer Groups, etc.). The HPSC Configuration Analyst understands the types of provider contracting arrangements and/or benefits administration data elements that need to be configured in KPCC platform applications to support the accurate and timely payment of claims. Uses Configuration Design templates to create and maintain artifacts (e.g. Build Worksheets to be used as documentation/specifications for 'Certification or National Testing Teams'). Consults appropriate internal partners on issues of interpretation/clarity. Performs other duties as assigned by Management. Essential Responsibilities: Includes all responsibilities of the Configuration Analyst I and. Configures either Professional & Institutional Providers or Complex Benefits. Leads business requirements development and solution design process including creation of requirements and design documentation and facilitating sessions with business owners and other team members). Maintains detailed knowledge and understanding of the host Claims processing system rules relative to claims payment. Coordinates, researches and resolves debarred and sanctioned provider data and ensures communication of required system updates to Provider Contracting and Claims Operations. Conducts preliminary evaluation of contractual agreement prior to execution to determine system configurability. Conducts systems requirement assessment in support of regulatory changes (e.g. ICD-10, ASC, DRG etc). Analyzes business requirements to determine the best approach for configuration design, testing and implementation. Analyzes benefit evidence of coverage to determine best approach for loading benefits plan offered including co-pays, out-of-pocket maximums and state/regulatory benefits coverage. Develops, documents and executes test plans for configuration testing and validates accuracy of data loaded. Acts as the liaison between business configuration and business owners to ensure that all application and technical-oriented issues relating to the configuration requests/projects are appropriately addressed. Writes/generates ad-hoc claims impact reports and compiles reconciliation statements. Tests new version releases relative to system configuration and documents results. Analyzes and make recommendations to management regarding system enhancements and communicates system problems and impact on operations. Acts as the subject matter expert regarding Configuration Activities for cross-regional/national initiatives. Assists in establishing, and documenting policies and procedures in support of standardized and accurate configuration. Validates design, testing and implementation of Configuration. Provides coaching and mentoring to team members, workload distribution, tracking and workflow management. Travels for team meetings up 25% of the time. Contributes to SBAR (Situation, Background, Alternative, Recommendation) process. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience Minimum three (3) years of experience as configuration analyst OR in health insurance or managed care environment or in claims adjudication with knowledge of at least one of the following: membership, benefits, provider contracts & pricing, medical reviews, referral authorizations and code review and fee schedules. Education Bachelor's degree in business, health care or other applicable field OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, Registration N/A Additional Requirements: Proficiency in Tapestry Modules as determined by management OR Benefits Modules within 6 months of hire into the job. Additional time to acquire certification may be permitted at management's discretion. Proficiency requires a minimum of 75% exam score with a 100% score on the associated projects. Both, Certification and Proficiency levels must be achieved within three times of completing Epic testing. If certification/KP proficiency is a requirement of the position, the individual must pass the application test by the third try. If not, consequences include termination or transition to a different role. Training and testing maybe delivered at Epic or KP Facility. Proficiency in Healthcare and Health Plan terminology, medical coding (e.g. CPT4, ICD9, and HCPCS), provider contract concepts and common claims adjudication practices and General Health plan functions. Intermediate knowledge MS Office Suite of products. Demonstrated ability to research, analyze, design, plan, organize, coordinate, implement, and perform necessary follow-up and closure procedures for system related deliverables. Understand relational databases. Strong experience in documentation, research and reporting. Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Excellent interpersonal, communication, & listening skills Proficiency in healthcare benefits, benefit administration and health care delivery from either/both a payor or provider perspective, EDI and paper claim lifecycle, along with health insurance industry practices and standards. Preferred Qualifications: Knowledgeable of state and federal regulations. Knowledge of Certification/Accreditation Standards (NCQA, JCAHO, CMS, etc.). Knowledge of Kaiser Permanente Internal processes. Knowledge of Epic Tapestry Modules. Prefer certification in Tapestry Modules (Certification requires a minimum of 80% exam score with a 100% score on the associated projects). Primary Location: Georgia-Atlanta-Regional Office - 9 Piedmont 9 Piedmont Center 34 Scheduled Hours (1-40): 40 Shift: Day Working Days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Working Hours Start: 8:00 AM Working Hours End: 4:30 pm Schedule: Full-time Job Type: Standard Employee Status: Regular Employee Group (Union Affiliation): Salaried, Non-Union, Exempt Job Level: Individual Contributor Job: Information Technology Public Department Name: BDM Travel: Yes, 25 % of the Time Job Eligible for Benefits: Yes External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Represent the department at any WEBUG meetings and work with Regional Web Team, as needed. Ensure internal Web sites stays within Regional and National structures by following the current policies and procedures of any National or Regional requirements. Represent department on activities involving the Learning Well. â€¢ Other duties as requested. Education â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ N/A Additional Requirements: â€¢ Thorough knowledge of graphic design techniques and principles (for Web sites). â€¢ Thorough knowledge of editing, desktop publishing techniques (especially with regard to forms and manuals), writing, publication design, printing and principles of communication. â€¢ Thorough understanding of the PC and Windows environment. â€¢ Basic knowledge of HTML and information architecture. â€¢ Basic knowledge of the Internet, including use of FTP. â€¢ Demonstrates customer-focused service skills. â€¢ Excellent oral and communication skills. â€¢ Solid design/page layout. â€¢ Knowledge of current software applications; e.g.,Adobe Pagemaker, Photoshop, Illustrator and Acrobat, Macromedia Dreamweaver and Fireworks, Flash, Access, MS Word, MS Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Lotus Notes. â€¢ Problem identification and resolution skills. â€¢ Graphic creation and manipulation. â€¢ Proficient editing, writing and grammar skills. â€¢ Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects within appropriate time frames. â€¢ Comprehensive knowledge of scanning. â€¢ Organizational, communication, ability to work well with others. title: Sr Data Consultant
requirement: Sr Data Consultant(Job Number: 483868) Working for an organization with the size and resources of Kaiser Permanente Northern California means having the potential to positively affect the health and well-being of entire communities. From our financial, business, and IT experts, to our RNs, allied health professionals, and physicians, we work together to provide the best care experience to our members and the communities we serve. As one of the most diverse regions in the country, Northern California offers everything from the majestic Sierra Mountains, to breathtaking Yosemite, to world-renowned Napa Valley. Here, you'll discover the cultural and recreational diversity that makes Northern California one of the most desirable places in the world to live and work. As Northern California's largest health plan, Kaiser Permanente provides you with the resources and opportunity to build a rewarding career in an environment that supports your success. Join us. Description Under general supervision, this position exists to assist the organization in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data. This position takes an active leadership role both as a consultant and as a high-level statistical analytics programmer. Essential Functions: â€¢ Leads, makes significant contributions, &/or provides technical leadership to high visibility projects to identify & resolve issues of strategic importance to the organization. â€¢ Interfaces regularly w/ Sr Mgmt to produce timely & valuable results. â€¢ Directs the development of outcomes & process measures, including technical specifications, to enable population measurement, guideline implementation, & evaluation. â€¢ Builds & maintains complex statistical routines using macros, vendor software, & software written by self & others. â€¢ Tests & maintains data integrity across multiple databases (internal SAS, DB2, VSAM; external: Adobe, Excel, SAS parsing routines, COBOL). â€¢ Builds sophisticated statistical models & forecasting tools using these databases. â€¢ Designs & enhances databases. â€¢ Designs menu systems that are effective & user-friendly. â€¢ Develops reports w/ accurate, easy to read, useful information that satisfies the client's needs. â€¢ Designs & generates tracking & monitoring tools. â€¢ Designs research plans for data gathering & analysis; participates significantly in interpreting analyses & developing action plans accordingly. â€¢ Defines & frames complex multi-dimensional healthcare issues & develops time tables/processes for decision making. â€¢ Translates needs, issues, & ideas into effective strategies & action plans. â€¢ Formulates specific implementation plans & evaluates the effectiveness of actions/programs implemented. Develops creative alternative solutions. â€¢ Works closely w/ IT & outside partners (& physicians for TPMG Depts). â€¢ Sets the strategic direction of projects. â€¢ Determines goals & priorities w/ team, clients, or project Mgmt sponsors (when appropriate). â€¢ May coordinate team/project activities & schedules. â€¢ May establish team membership & project participants, provide leadership to multi-disciplinary project teams, as well as manage work of outside consultants when used. â€¢ Communicates results/recommendations to project sponsors, clients, & various Sr level audiences (including physicians for TPMG Depts). â€¢ May participate in the development & Mgmt of the Dept, including coaching & recruiting for consultants/analysts & other departmental activities. â€¢ KP conducts compensation reviews of positions on a routine basis. At any time, KP reserves the right to reevaluate & change job descriptions, or to change such positions from salaried to hourly pay status. Such changes are generally implemented only after notice is given to affected employees. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum five (5) years of programming in SAS, SQL, VBA, .net or equivalent statistical analytical programming language. â€¢ Minimum five (5) years of related analytical consulting experience. Education â€¢ Master's degree in economics, finance, health care administration, public health administration, statistics, mathematics, operations research, or related field required, or equivalent bachelor's degree and two (2) years additional work experience in lieu of a master's degree. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ N/A Additional Requirements: â€¢ Experience with analytical manipulation and interpretation of large databases. â€¢ Experience with MVS/TSO operating systems. â€¢ Exceptional analytic and critical thinking skills, writing skills, communication skills, consulting skills, and ability to work within a team. â€¢ Ability to express complex analytical and technical information to senior management or to audiences with clinical training. â€¢ Proven leadership in consulting and, for some areas, project management. Must exhibit efficiency, collaboration, candor, openness, and results orientation. â€¢ Broad familiarity with medical practices, especially population management and process and outcomes measurement. â€¢ Must be an independent self-starter. â€¢ Microsoft Office skills required. â€¢ Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment. Preferred Qualifications: â€¢ Knowledge of JCL strongly preferred. title: Business Analyst Senior
requirement: Business Analyst Senior(Job Number: 492283) Here in Hawaii, the spirit of aloha permeates our daily actions and interactions. It's a welcoming spirit and one that's alive and well at Kaiser Permanente Hawaii. Since 1958, we have proudly served our island communities as 'ohana. Today, each of us-from our finance, business, and IT experts, to our RNs, allied health professionals, and physicians-contributes to that ongoing mission. If you're looking to be a part of our rich heritage of care, this is the place to put your beliefs into practice. Description Provides consulting and analytic services to leadership by educating/training or performing/facilitating analysis in issue identification, organizational risk assessment and process for decision making. Defines and conducts planning studies and projects. Inteprets, organizes, and presents data to leadership for strategic decision making and defining business direction. Works in close partnership with counterparts in organization. Essential Functions: â€¢ Ensures impartial consideration of all information in developing decision alternatives. Interprets internal and external data for decision making. â€¢ Ensures analysis and studies are performed as requested. Develops methodology and processes to set priorities for project scheduling. Monitors implementation. â€¢ Develops, designs, plans, facilitates, and coordinates use of management decision-making tools, monitoring tools, decision support models and work process analysis in operations and improvements. â€¢ Communicates effectively through written reports, graphical representations, and oral presentations to leadership. â€¢ Recommends process to conduct, analyze, and uncover root causes to issues. Applies knowledge of findings to solve problems. â€¢ Leads teams through problem assessment phase to implementation of solutions. Facilitates meetings as needed. â€¢ Collaborates with other analysts to ensure integration and alignment. â€¢ Provides education/training to other analysts of process improvement. Mentors and coaches other analysts. â€¢ Acts as a role model for teamwork among the other analysts. Promotes strong relationships, trusts, morale and cooperation among team members. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum five (5) years of operations analyst or related experience. â€¢ Project management/project lead experience. Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree in business administration, systems, planning, health care administration, public health administration, or related field, OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ N/A Additional Requirements: â€¢ Demonstrated ability to identify and resolve issues, collection, analysis, and interpretation of data. â€¢ Broad knowledge of business operations. â€¢ Demonstrated ability to provide consulting and analytical services to leadership. â€¢ Demonstrated knowledge of and skill in decision making, customer service, group presentations, group process facilitation, influence, interpersonal relations, oral communication, problem solving, project management, quality management, results orientation, systems thinking, team building, teamwork, and written communication. â€¢ Demonstrated knowledge of and skill in the following word processing, multimedia presentations, spreadsheet and database PC applications. Preferred Qualifications: â€¢ Health care operations experience. â€¢ Planning experience in managed care organization. â€¢ Knowledge of Quality Management principles, processes and tools. â€¢ Ability to conceptualize processes across entire organization. â€¢ Quantitative modeling techniques. Primary Location: Hawaii-Honolulu-Hospital/Medical Offices 3288 Moanalua Rd. Alternative Work Locations: Hawaii-Honolulu-Malama Ohana SNF/Lab 3288 Moanalua Rd. title: Lead Project Manager, Pharmacy Testing and Quality - Testing Center of Excellence (TCoE).
requirement: Lead Project Manager, Pharmacy Testing and Quality - Testing Center of Excellence (TCoE).(Job Number: 489172) We're looking for big ideas-ideas that can embrace multiple petabytes of vital information. That's how much data we manage and store at Kaiser Permanente. We're home to some other big ideas, like creating KP HealthConnect, the nation's largest electronic medical record system, using social media and text messaging to help members engage in their own care, and developing predictive modeling tools that anticipate health issues before they're an issue. It's the kind of thinking that's shaping the future of technology, health care, and the lives of all of our members. If you're ready to contribute your own big ideas, join us. Description This position exists within the Care Delivery (CD) Technology Shared Services and Pharmacy (TSSP) providing tactical management, development, and guidance for the Pharmacy Testing and Quality (PTQ) team of the Testing Center of Excellence (TCoE) working under the guidance of the Pharmacy Testing & Quality Manager. The Pharmacy testing & Quality groupâ€™s primary focus is quality delivery of a fully functional production application and support of integration between non pharmacy and pharmacy applications. Helping its customers meet their goals in delivery quality, affordability, and thought leadership. To support this work, this individual will need to provide support with critical organizations, stakeholders, regional leaders, and our strategic partner to facilitate key relationships that will provide influence/feedback in the maintenance and evolution of the pharmacy testing manual/automation team. It is critical that the Project Manager Lead interacts with subordinates, FlexPool resource supplier, outside customers/stakeholders, and functional peer groups at management, middle management levels on a regular basis. Therefore, they must possess the ability to present, organize and succinctly convey information to a broad audience in a variety of formats/styles. The Project Manager Lead will need to possess the ability to influence the thinking of, or gain the acceptance of others in sensitive situations. The successful candidate will also need to possess the ability to provide clarity and direction in ambiguous situations. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills; expectations to interface with Business and IT leaders. Successful candidate must have exceptional analysis and metrics creation, executive presentation, process modeling, and requirements elicitation skills. Successful candidate will work on significant and unique issues where analysis of situations or data requires an ability to create quality outcomes in an ambiguous environment. Although an IT/testing background is desired, it is not required; however, the successful candidate must have fundamental knowledge of core industry project management / leadership standards. Consulting experience leveraging quality control analytics and continuous improvement on process and standardization is highly desired. This role will also act as a liaison between PMO, Intake team, vendor management and PTQ Management. The successful candidateâ€™s primary focus will be to support the investment project management. Intake estimates of new work and resource utilization, deliverable tracking, risk and issue management along with forecasts and tracking to budget. A secondary focus of the successful candidate will be to provide operational support in Release Planning, overall project planning and improve existing operational processes within the QA/Testing space; utilizing industry standard continuous improvement techniques. The Project Manager Lead will assume accountability for the following: Cost Containment - Monitor our efficiency and transparency of managing the financial and operational aspects of the testing pharmacy budget. Support delivery of efficiency and competency - Monitors accountability and enforcement of governance and contract variables (SLA's, KPI's, and Deliverables); needed to support existing engagements as well as the scaling of testing resources and flex pool resources via staff augmentation. Compliance adherence - Ensures KP compliance and TCOE operational best practices are upheld. Monitor and track performance according to contractual obligations and total performance standards. Efficienciesâ€“ Ownership and accountability to institutionalize domain best practice across the pharmacy testing group and align with Testing Center of Excellence best practices in the effort to maximize reuse, cost savings, efficiencies supporting a One KP Practice. Description KP is building and evolving its Cyber Security Architecture program. The goal of the program is to achieve complete alignment of information security function with the enterprise business goals and priorities. The program is also geared to provide business and IT contextual security architecture guidance that fosters standardization and interoperability across IT implementations at KP. The program also engages in medium to large scale multi-million dollar projects to provide security requirements and design guidance to help secure KPâ€™s sensitive data and services. Role Overview As a principal security architect you will be responsible to help evolve cyber security architecture program for all of KP. The role will entail working with various information security groups, enterprise architects and business groups to define the security architecture function in order to support KP's strategic business direction and priorities. The role will also involve developing business attributes, architecture frameworks, controls methodology etc that are custom and contextual to KP's business processes, culture and IT function yet flexible to adapt to emerging people, process and technology landscape. Key Responsibilities â€¢ Develop methodology/framework for providing consistent and repeatable security architecture guidance to multi-million dollar enterprise projects by working alongside various IT teams and business customers and groups. â€¢ Identify opportunities to evolve, evangelize and embed security architecture standards and processes into existing enterprise processes to ensure standardization of IT implementations. â€¢ Assist in developing a security architecture program that demonstrates complete end-to-end traceability of security solutions to business goals. â€¢ Develop appropriate technical and business security metrics for the cyber security architecture program to depict current state, demonstrate value and progress to diverse set of IT and Business Audience at all levels. â€¢ Develop presentations for KP's executives that explain complex security topics in a very simple business oriented language along with their business benefits. â€¢ Position the cyber security architecture program as the lifeline for all information security functions and develop inputs/outputs and processes for integrating with various groups like security strategy, security consulting, risk assessment, security detection and incidence response etc. â€¢ Mentor and review security engagements executed by security solution architects within the cyber security architecture program. â€¢ Develop methodologies for security architecture standards and patterns and lead the security architecture governance function at an enterprise level. â€¢ Develop communication strategy and plans for the enterprise security architecture function by partnering with business and enterprise architects. â€¢ Provide security architecture guidance that is built on principles of balancing security advice with business and IT needs to position security architecture program as a business enabler. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: â€¢ Bachelor's degree in a related field and/or a minimum of 4 years of equivalent work experience. â€¢ A minimum of 15 years of Information Technology experience including the development and maintenance of IT technical architecture and standards. â€¢ Experience with large complex programs or national strategic initiatives. Preferred Qualifications: â€¢ At this level graduate coursework may be expected. â€¢ Experience with projects with budgets of up to $250M with multiple sites or regions, and/or up to 40 integrated work tracks. â€¢ 7 + years of Information Security Experience. With 4+ years in security architecture for a medium to large size organization. â€¢ Very strong interpersonal skills and ability to establish strong cross-organizational partnerships â€¢ Experience building reference architecture and conceptual architecture for security problem spaces and security controls. â€¢ Ability to translate business requirements and priorities into security architecture standards â€¢ Strong leadership skills and ability to listen and build consensus and collaborate with business, IT and security groups at KP â€¢ Ability to translate security concepts into business language and present to executive level audience â€¢ Strategic thinker with experience identifying, reviewing and solving enterprise level security problems to support and enable business priorities. â€¢ Expertise in one or more security domains â€“ application, network, platform/devices, data â€¢ Familiarity or experience with business driven security architecture methodologies like SABSA, OpenGroup etc. â€¢ Strong understanding of regulatory requirements including HIPAA, SOX , PCI â€¢ CISSP â€¢ Presenter / Speaker at leading conference â€¢ Experience designing security architecture for large scale applications/infrastructures â€¢ Strong understanding of financial concepts.
