title: Research Database Consultant
requirement: Research Database Consultant(Job Number: 490517) Working for an organization with the size and resources of Kaiser Permanente Northern California means having the potential to positively affect the health and well-being of entire communities. From our financial, business, and IT experts, to our RNs, allied health professionals, and physicians, we work together to provide the best care experience to our members and the communities we serve. As one of the most diverse regions in the country, Northern California offers everything from the majestic Sierra Mountains, to breathtaking Yosemite, to world-renowned Napa Valley. Here, you'll discover the cultural and recreational diversity that makes Northern California one of the most desirable places in the world to live and work. As Northern California's largest health plan, Kaiser Permanente provides you with the resources and opportunity to build a rewarding career in an environment that supports your success. Join us. Description The primary objective of this position is to develop interface software that will connect the Oracle-based Northern California Research Database (NCRDB) at DOR with multiple data sources that will be used to populate and update the NCRDB. A second objective is to develop interfaces for analytic programmers who query and retrieve data from the NCRDB for analysis. A third objective is to develop interfaces that will allow non-programmers to view NCRDB data for cohort selection, case finding, etc. Data sources include both static and dynamic legacy data sets, KP HealthConnect (KPHC) databases (Clarity and Chronicles/Cache) and ancillary systems (Tracemaster, Genetics, etc.). The interface software will include both one-time extract, transform and load (ETL) applications to populate the NCRDB with past data, and update ETLs that will keep the NCRDB up-to-date with dynamic data sources, such as the KPHC databases. The NCRDB will support the needs of epidemiological and health services researchers in DOR, and eventually the needs of researchers in other Kaiser Permanente regions. Essential Responsibilities: Work with KP-IT personnel in NCAL and DOR programmers to identify various data sources, and understand the structure, format and definitions of the data in those data sources. Develop or compile documentation about each data source that will be incorporated in the metadata database. Work with the DOR Database Architect and Database Administrator to transform those data and metadata into the NRDB schema and metadata repository. Work with researchers to identify database reporting needs and develop reports using Business Intelligence software. Work with other data owners to determine the structure of ancillary data sources to be loaded into NRDB. Monitor the ETL process. Monitor database loading script logs and trouble-shoot loading problems. Monitor database backup logs and trouble-shoot backup problems. Maintain the NRDB Metadata repository with documentation about the data. Train investigators and SAS programmers in the user of the NRDB. Support end-users in building Oracle SQL queries and views Extract ad hoc research files from the NRDB as needed for DOR and collaborative projects. Provide high-quality information, training, and data support for Division of Research (DOR) researchers and programmers, with an emphasis on data and cross-platform processing and computing. Perform complex tasks involved in Scoping, Analyzing, Defining, Documenting and Building complex data sets, databases and associated processes that integrate EMR data from heterogeneous Kaiser automated systems to an easily accessible format to simply reporting by DOR Research Investigators and their teams. Responsible for documenting project requirements, planning and executing daily project activities, communicating with relevant internal and external dependent individuals/groups, adhering to project schedules and resolving blocking issues. Maintain and modify the Data Architecting for all Virtual Data Warehouse. Provide data analysis, manipulate and interpret data from various sources. Define business rules, test, consistency and accuracy. Implementing fixes and enhances. Collect user concerns, analyze, work with SMEs and take action accordingly - make code changes or educate users. Keep track of changes happening source systems (Health Connect and Clarity). Make appropriate adjustments to ETLs to support those source system changes. Maintain and develop new data acquisition areas, data transformation, and Meta Data for CESR (Center for Effectiveness & Safety Research) and HMORN. Coordinate communication with HMORN and other data networks by giving regular updates on KPNC CESR activities on issues such as quality checks, documentation, and general progress. Establish/maintain data quality and security for local data, in accordance with CESR and HMORN standards. Interface with regional research centers regarding workload, other regional issues. Communicate complex technical concepts clearly to peers and management including staff without a technical background. Exhibit strong technical and leadership qualities coupled with unwavering dedication and commitment to customers. Work independently with minimal supervision in a fast paced and rapidly changing environment with tight delivery schedules. Exceptional vision and strategic orientation. Deal with multiple concurrent projects. Track record of generating new ideas and solutions to business problems and the vision and tenacity to translate that vision into quantifiable results. Lead large scale projects which were related to one of the following: regulatory issues, program-wide issue, or interdepartmental issue. Design large Data Warehouses, accessing data from a variety of platforms and data sources such as mainframes, PCs, tapes, servers. Creating business rules understand algorithm, complexity and advanced data structures. Solve computer program performance issues and to translate business requirements into tangible deliverables. Writing Java programs when necessary. Develop Perl scripting, MS SQL and scripting (VB) in MS SQL. Manipulate, analysis, and report development. Mentor other team members with in-depth knowledge of relational database key components and theory. Kaiser Permanente conducts compensation reviews of positions on a routine basis. At any time, Kaiser Permanente reserves the right to reevaluate and change job descriptions, or to change such positions from salaried to hourly pay status. Such changes are generally implemented only after notice is given to affected employees. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience Minimum five (5) years of experience with PL/SQL writing ETL programs. Minimum five (5) years of experience in Data ANALYSIS, writing technical requirements, and users training on technical topics relating to ETL codes and building logic. Minimum five (5) years of experience as a senior data developer using terabits of data. Education Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, engineering or computer science. License, Certification, Registration N/A Additional Requirements: Team lead experience and/or project manager experience of at least two years. Preferred Qualifications: Minimum of five (5) years experience in the following areas: SAS building SAS datasets; Java Programming; Business intelligence software, such as Cognos, Business Objects, and Crystal Reports to generate reports from relational databases; Use of Medical terminology and medical coding; Working in a healthcare delivery and/or research environment; IBM JCL mainframe; Unix shell scripting, Perl scripting, MS SQL and scripting (VB) in MS SQL environment. Masters degree. title: Regional Perioperative Resource Analyst - KSMC
requirement: Regional Perioperative Resource Analyst - KSMC(Job Number: 488714) At Kaiser Permanente Northwest, the work you do every day supports the health of our members. That's because each of us-from our financial, business, and IT experts, to our RNs, allied health professionals, and physicians-shares a commitment to providing the best possible care experience. Widely regarded as a mecca for outdoor enthusiasts, the Pacific Northwest blends urban bustle with open space in a way that is sure to enhance your own state of well-being. Looking to build a rewarding career in an environment that supports your success? Join us and put your beliefs into practice. Description Business Analyst Perioperative Resource will be a key member of the Surgical Services team of the Kaiser NW region. This position is accountable for daily review of the ORAAG to identify trends and opportunities to improve OR utilization. Closely collaborates with clinic schedulers, DA and ADA's to fill in unused block times in the OR for better efficiency. Partnering with clinics to understand any scheduling barriers and identifying any improvement initiatives in collaboration with business office and specialty care. Working closely with Regional Block Committee (RBC), OR management, specialty care and business office perioperative services, this position is responsible for building effective partnerships and promoting collaborative relationships that improves OR access. Reports to the Regional Manager Perioperative Resource. Essential Responsibilities: Regional OR Utilization: Daily reviewing of the OR at a Glance (ORAAG) and proactively looking for opportunities for services to pick up any open time in the active ORAAG. Identify and communicate effectively to the clinics about any open time including involuntary block releases. Work towards removing any barriers to getting elective cases scheduled in the ORs. Collaborate with clinic schedulers, department administrators, assistant DAs and managers around better OR access for the patients, efforts in reducing backlogs for services, OR utilization improvement tactics with changes in scheduling practices. Identify new scheduling workflow opportunities and share information with specialty care and work on any new initiatives in collaboration. Assist in general ORAAG management including updating blue notes, looking at add on cases, looking at the case depots including add on depots. Analyzing utilization trends- Analyzing overall OR utilization trends and service level utilization trends and sharing the information at appropriate forums. This will include finding the reasons why a particular service is trending one way and evaluating how much increase or decrease in allocated block time for that service will help the trend go in the positive direction. Overall evaluation of the ORs on how much block time is being utilized and how much is not being utilized by the services. In Collaboration with business manager put together the data showing the services that can benefit with more or less OR block time in future block allocations. Regional Reporting and Adhoc Reports: Produce ad hoc report requests for perioperative services stakeholders including OR Directors, Managers, RBC, Specialty care and Permanente partners. Develop new reports based on stakeholders request or identified business needs. Collaborate with business manager to produce key metrics for the region including blue room metrics for ORs and procedure rooms, ontime starts and turnover time reports. This will involve learning DIME and EPIC reporting tools. Serve as the OR scheduling process champion. Have full understanding of how a case request is created in clinics and its journey through central surgery scheduling ultimately getting the case scheduled in the appropriate ORs. Have extensive knowledge of RBC related scheduling documents and scheduling guidelines for each OR location. Help develop/update any new or existing training material for the clinic schedulers including central surgery schedulers. Share any new learnings from any training courses/education with the team. Stakeholders Relationships / Communications: Accurately and effectively communicates all required information to colleagues, customers, and other departments. Influence decisions through written and verbal communications. Build consensus between Surgical Services and other specialty care departments/teams. Use established channels of communication to share information. Open to receiving positive comments and feedback. Follows up on feedback and work towards fixing any identified report related issues. Build credibility with central surgery schedulers, specialty care, clinic schedulers, RBC and OR management. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience Minimum three (3) years of experience managing health care related projects Minimum two (2) years of managing complex projects. Education Bachelor's degree in business administration, health care administration OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, Registration N/A Additional Requirements: Knowledge of EPIC or equivalent system. Strong proficiency in the use of current office software. Excellent experience with Microsoft excel, pivot tables, charts and graphs. Skills: efficient, collaborative, candid, open, and results-oriented. Facilitate teams or groups of key stakeholders from all levels and segments of the organization. Ability to solve multifaceted problem touching different department's workflow. Be assertive, objective and be able to confront clients with difficult issues. Develop and present quantitative/qualitative analysis to help department achieve its goals. Determine the key business issues and develop appropriate action plans. Strong interpersonal and communication skills (1:1, peer, multi-disciplinary group, presentations, written). Preferred Qualifications: Minimum five (5) years of experience in an OR scheduling work environment. Minimum five (5) years of progressively responsible data management and analysis experience in health care setting. Master's degree in business administration, Health Ed., or Social Science Comprehensive working knowledge of Kaiser Permanente Operations, culture, personnel, organizational structure and values. Description The Principal of Service Management for Service Operations leads the operational delivery and management of Storage Area Network (SAN) infrastructure products, programs, and service offerings (Primarily EMC and Brocade products). Provides leadership, governance and oversight to multiple complex suppliers and outsourcers like IBM, TCS, Oracle and Accenture, among others. Drives results from outsourcing providers, strategic partners and vendors. Escalating issues with diplomacy and urgency, working with account teams that have a global presence. As a principal level member of Service Operations is accountable for championing change, process improvements and cultural transformation to implement strategic programs for continuous improvement. Ensures plans are in place to accomplish service management goals, results are tracked and priorities are aligned to execute on program improvement initiatives. Partners with Business Relationship Managers, Business Information Officers, and Application Delivery teams to respond to escalations, resolve service delivery issues, and drive process improvements based on service management feedback. title: Project Management Associate
requirement: Project Management Associate(Job Number: 483232) We're looking for big ideas-ideas that can embrace multiple petabytes of vital information. That's how much data we manage and store at Kaiser Permanente. We're home to some other big ideas, like creating KP HealthConnect, the nation's largest electronic medical record system, using social media and text messaging to help members engage in their own care, and developing predictive modeling tools that anticipate health issues before they're an issue. It's the kind of thinking that's shaping the future of technology, health care, and the lives of all of our members. If you're ready to contribute your own big ideas, join us. Description Named to the Computerworld Top 100 Best Places to Work, the Kaiser Permanente Information Technology (IT) organization is the team that powers the health IT leadership of Kaiser Permanente (KP). Driving national news coverage and influencing the health care agenda in Washington, D.C., the technology strategies and innovations of this 6,500 person strong, multi-billion dollar technology division are at the forefront of KP's commitment to help shape the future of health care. KP is recognized as one of America's leading health care providers and not-for-profit health plans. As one of the nation's leaders in quality health care for over 55 years, Kaiser Permanente is dedicated to enhancing health care delivery through state-of-the-art information tools and top-notch talent. The experts at Kaiser Permanente Information Technology are at the heart of that mission and you can be one of them. If you are excited about working with cutting edge technology and have the right blend of creativity and experience, consider the following opportunity within our Care Delivery Business Information Office. We are seeking a highly motivated team oriented person, excited about developing your project management skills and knowledge by working closely with experienced KP HealthConnect Project Managers. As a key member of our vital patient safety team, you will track patient safety code and coordinate code installation efforts with our regional partners. Essential Functions: â€¢ Support Lead Project Manager level or higher while learning & verifying PM skills knowledge set. Total Managed Project Budget: Up to $500K. â€¢ Project Complexity: Minimal complexity w/oversight of Lead Project Manager level or above. 1 site. 1 work track. Project may involve enhancements to 1 or 2 applications or small project. Project is linked to single business unit or function. Project will not require integration testing w/ another application. â€¢ Project Integration Management: (Project Charter, Scope, Project Management Plan, Direct & Manage Project Execution, Control Work & Changes, Close Out). Assists w/the development of project plan under the direction of a Lead Project Manager, or above. Completes the assigned tasks on the project plan. Develops the success criteria, development, publication & updating of project deliverables for the review of the Lead Project Manager. Assists in the development & execution of user adoption, implementation & training plans. Assists w/project close-out activities. May assist w/the post-implementation review. â€¢ Project Scope Management: (Scope planning, definition, WBS, scope verification, scope control) Understands use of change Management process, resources, schedule, and scope for assigned project. Demonstrates use of change Management process-resources, schedule, scope for assigned project under supervision of Lead Project Manager level & above. May request changes in schedule, scope & budget & re-negotiate w/sponsor as needed to higher level PM. â€¢ Project Time Management: (Detailed activity & resource planning, on time control) Understands the correlation between time tracking & ABC Learns the tracking of interdependencies (start to finish relationships) w/in the project. Understands "on time" metric & process. â€¢ Project Cost Management: Detailed activity & resource costing, on budget control, develop & manage forecasts) Understands "total cost of ownership" concept. Contributes to the accuracy of IT components of the business case. W/support negotiates agreement on project schedule & budgets. Assists in the preparation of project forecast for resources/labor hours & translates into financial forecast. Helps manage to project budget & proactively communicates project cost variances & provides variance explanations. Applies learning in relation to the governance bodies & their purposes e.g., RAC, PAC, ITAC, Consultant Oversight Committee. â€¢ Project Quality Management: (Project quality plan, perform quality assurance & control) Observes & learns to assist w/quality assurance reviews & quality control monitoring efforts. W/guidance may coordinate the development of quality/testing strategies for the project. Proposes a quality assurance plan for assigned project track. Identifies project metrics for the review & approval of Lead Project Manager. â€¢ Project Human Resources Management: (HR Planning, Acquire, Develop, and Manage Team) under the general supervision of a Lead (or higher) Project Manager-will: Learn to allocate resources, establish schedules, & makes task assignments. Makes recommendations for resource requirements & upon approval, procures resources. May provide input in assigning roles & responsibilities of key participants. May assign work, set priorities, provide guidance in the completion of tasks, & review deliverables. May escalate performance issues of team members. Supports team building & development activities. May provide constructive feedback to others. Manages the work of the project team. â€¢ This job description is not all encompassing. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum five (5) years of experience as Project Coordinator. Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree in related field Or four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ N/A Additional Requirements: â€¢ Some knowledge of policies, practices and systems. â€¢ Limited use and/or application of basic principles, theories, and concepts. â€¢ Limited knowledge of industry practices and standards. â€¢ Learning Project Management methodologies and practices to develop PM expertise to manage larger projects. â€¢ Learns and applies approved IT and business project management methods to projects to build expertise in PM â€¢ Learns and adheres to approved IT project management standards and controls â€¢ Proficient in Microsoft Word, Project, Excel, Visio and Powerpoint â€¢ Proficient in RPM for time reporting, scheduling, and project management â€¢ Understands Remedy to review release schedules â€¢ Understands Ariba to procure goods and services â€¢ Understands Cognos for financial processes â€¢ Understands Borland suite for requirements, testing, and document management. Preferred Qualifications: â€¢ Very strong organizational skills â€¢ Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills, strong customer service focus, and excellent interpersonal skills â€¢ Proficient in Lotus Notes and Microsoft Office 365 â€¢ Results oriented and team focused â€¢ Ability to work in a dynamic environment with cross-functional teams â€¢ Ability to work under pressure and in challenging settings Primary Location: Oregon-Lake Oswego Scheduled Hours (1-40): 40 Shift: Day Working Days: Mon-Fri Working Hours Start: 8:00 AM Working Hours End: 5:00 PM Schedule: Full-time Job Type: Standard Employee Status: Regular Employee Group (Union Affiliation): Non-Union, Non-Exempt Job Level: Entry Level Job: Information Technology Public Department Name: CD BIO Travel: Yes, 5 % of the Time Job Eligible for Benefits: Yes External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. The Consultant Specialist will report to the Endpoint Strategy team, which is responsible for establishing technology standards, playbooks and insertion points for end user computing technologies at Kaiser Permanente. Responsibilities: Technology leaders at Kaiser Permanente think strategically and drive for results. They help the organization innovate by thinking differently, and refuse to accept "that's how we've always done it" as an acceptable response to change. They help our customers embrace new ideas that improve our workforce productivity and create compelling experiences for our members. across the business (e.g. End User Services, Endpoint Design, Technology Risk Office, Corporate Services/Digital Strategy) Your team will partner with our customers in developing Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) using cutting edge end user computing technologies that optimize workforce productivity and deliver value-added member experiences today, while using the validated learning as a foundation for the future The MVPs and validated learning will help your team select and acquire the appropriate technologies/vendors/platforms, and deliver the technology standards, playbooks, the appropriate insertion points needed to successfully implement these solutions at scale Qualifications Passion for being at the leading edge of technology, with a minimum of 5 years of hands-on PC and Service, Workspace Aggregators, BYOx, Cloud-Based Device Configuration Management, Macs as an Enterprise Offering, and much more Ability to empathize and act strategically with all stakeholders Excellent oral and written communication skills Strong analytical and leadership skills Good project and time management skills BS in Computer Science / MS or equivalent work-related experience Desired Skills and Experience: A self-starter who is able to learn new technologies quickly, and is also able to work openly and collaboratively as a team player in a big company environment A vision for the next generation end user computing experience, a positive attitude and the persistence to execute on that vision are the keys to success in this role Vendor management experience, including RFPs Experience working in or creating a design for joy/lean startup environment is a plus Entrepreneurial/Entrepreneur in Residence/Intrapreneurial experience is a plus Cover letter highly encouraged. Description Job Title: Cloud Services Programmer Analyst; IaaS Integration Automation & Blueprint Description Kaiser Permanente IT is looking for recent college graduates with 4 yearsâ€™ worth of experience to work on our Cloud Services environment. In this position, candidates will work to develop new product offerings provided to our customers in a healthcare-grade enterprise cloud solution that encompasses both internal private cloud as well as offerings on AWS, Azure and other external providers. Creation of these new offerings requires a software development background. Development work includes creating new programs/applications/automation/orchestration components to support a business need; project-based processes involving all aspects of the project life cycle from inception to implementation, conducted internally or through a vendor-supported program/applications; and ongoing maintenance of the program/application This role will be part of the Cloud Services Group; Integration, Automation & Blueprint (IAB) team, a team responsible for the material implementation of services on our Click2Cloud offering. Your efforts will be needed for Kaiser Permanente IT to continue their rapid adoption of cloud services and execute next generation cloud and platform technologies which focus on speed to market, resiliency and recovery. He/she will also provide counsel and aid during initial implementation and help as needed for optimization initiatives in the cloud and platform technologies space. Candidates open-minded technologist, capable of working in a team of highly talented and experienced individuals. The selected candidate will need to consistently strive to understand and maintain currency in a broad technology set in order to drive and execute against a full program lifecycle. Essential Functions: Programmer Analyst Job Duties: Identifies and understand product requirements Arranges project requirements in programming sequence by analyzing requirements; preparing a work flow chart and diagram using knowledge of service capabilities, subject matter, programming language, and logic. Programs cloud products by encoding project requirements in appropriate, standardized computer language Confirms program operation by conducting tests; modifying program sequence and/or codes. Provides reference for use by writing and maintaining documentation Maintains computer systems and programming guidelines Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Develops and maintains software systems. Qualifications Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience 4 years of experience in Application Development or equivalent work experience Education Minimum Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems or related field or 4 years of equivalent work experience. Preferred Qualifications: 1 years of cloud and platform technologies experience Current in vmWare VRA Suite / vCloud Enterprise Suite or similar cloud management suite such as openstack. Familiar with or capable of learning automation languages such as Puppet and / or Chef Primary Location: California-Pleasanton-Pleasanton Tech Cntr Building E 5820 Owens Dr. Scheduled Hours (1-40): 40 Shift: Day Working Days: Mon - Fri Working Hours Start: 8:00 AM Working Hours End: 5:00 PM Schedule: Full-time Job Type: Standard Employee Status: Regular Employee Group (Union Affiliation): Non-Union, Non-Exempt Job Level: Individual Contributor Job: Information Technology Public Department Name: CTO CSG Travel: Yes, 5 % of the Time Job Eligible for Benefits: Yes External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. Description Healthcare is undergoing tremendous change and transition, and Kaiser Permanente (KP) is set to meet these challenges. KPâ€™s CCS establishes and deploys standard technology platforms across contact centers, allowing seamless call routing based on unique member needs, greater efficiency in handling peak call volume, and better preparation for disaster recovery. The execution of KPâ€™s CCS will not only help KP better serve its customers, it will also provide an improved work environment in its contact centers through the development of common processes and industry standard capability The Health Plan Contact Centers Strategy group within the Health Plan Business Information Office (HP BIO) of Kaiser Permanenteâ€™s Information Technology division (KPIT) is looking for an exceptional Director of Architecture to lead a team in supporting the Enterprise Telephony Infrastructure platform (i.e. virtualization of multiple call centers, multi-channel access, intelligent routing, computer telephony integration, telephonic and web self-service, and common/intelligent desktops, etc.). negotiate and create deliverable commitments and resolve issues in ways that are mutually satisfactory to the business partners and the IT organization. â€¢ Contribute to the creation of a high performance leadership team by providing motivation, leadership, and professional development of the IT staff. â€¢ Provide input to IT strategy and planning on impacts of business strategies while developing and maintaining demand forecasts for IT solutions and services. â€¢ Provide leadership in program/project prioritization and release packaging that accounts for business partner needs. â€¢ Coordinate and consult with business partners on IT requests. â€¢ Coordinate continual process improvement in business partner working relationships and in managing work requirements within and among IT departments. â€¢ Maintain professional and technical knowledge by tracking emerging trends in call center operations management. â€¢ Participate in the corporate IT annual and long-term budget process. â€¢ Travel as required (10-25%). title: Lead Site Support Specialist
requirement: Lead Site Support Specialist(Job Number: 461382) Working for an organization with the size and resources of Kaiser Permanente Northern California means having the potential to positively affect the health and well-being of entire communities. From our financial, business, and IT experts, to our RNs, allied health professionals, and physicians, we work together to provide the best care experience to our members and the communities we serve. As one of the most diverse regions in the country, Northern California offers everything from the majestic Sierra Mountains, to breathtaking Yosemite, to world-renowned Napa Valley. Here, you'll discover the cultural and recreational diversity that makes Northern California one of the most desirable places in the world to live and work. As Northern California's largest health plan, Kaiser Permanente provides you with the resources and opportunity to build a rewarding career in an environment that supports your success. Join us. Description Provides direction and support for the immediate end-user support to patient care and business process teams to facilitate the introduction, acceptance, integration and use of KP HealthConnect and related systems. Leads others in performing hardware and application support, workflow integration and training, troubleshooting, and consulting on related applications. Essential Responsibilities: Leads a team in providing end-user support for the use of the KP HealthConnect system including other related system implementations and upgrades. Ensures that service requests, diagnoses, troubleshooting and coordinated resolution of technical problems and information technology issues related to the electronic medical record. Analyze complex situations in the clinical environment to resolve technical problems. Identify and coordinate new processes, system functionality, system changes and enhancements to support clinical information and meet business needs. Facilitates the installation and implementation of KP HealthConnect and hardware equipment between IT departments and the patient care and business process teams. Develop processes to promote and communicate the integration of new or enhanced business and clinical systems into the business and patient care setting and their effectiveness. Provide coaching, training and consulting to end-user and all levels including Site Support Specialists to develop and facilitate learning of basic and specialized applications. Coordinates, leads and facilitates projects for application implementations to include testing, evaluating and documenting new KPHC department workflows. Develops, delivers and maintains continuing education programs for groups of end-users; identifies areas that are prone to problems and works with end-users to increase knowledge and skills. Shares knowledge and learning with other Site Support Specialist. Supervision Received: Receives general direction from Manager; assists in all levels of supervision. Instructs, guides and oversees work of lower-level technical staff. Acts as mentor and coach; trains staff; inputs to performance review. Problem Solving & Decision Making: Analyzes moderately complex problems and takes corrective action. Works autonomously typically dealing with issues independently Collaborates with Associates and Intermediates, Senior, and Manager to suggest resolution of problems. Such changes are generally implemented only after notice is given to affected employees. Minimum six (6) years of health care operations experience. Education Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. Strong analytical ability and interpersonal skills to communicate with clients, other staff and vendors. Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment. Preferred Qualifications: Minimum of one (1) year of supervisory experience. Knowledge of computer science theory or health care, application and customer support experience. Description Under general supervision, this position exists to assist the organization in making strategic data-related decisions by analyzing, manipulating, tracking, internally managing and reporting data. This position functions both as consultant and as a high-level statistical analytics programmer. Essential Functions: â€¢ Designs and enhances databases. â€¢ Designs menu systems that are effective and user-friendly. â€¢ Develops reports with accurate, easy to read, useful information. â€¢ Designs and generates tracking and monitoring tools. â€¢ Participates in the development of outcomes and process measures, including technical specifications, to enable population measurement, guideline implementation, and evaluation. â€¢ Builds and maintains complex statistical routines using macros, vendor software, and software written by self and others. â€¢ Tests and maintains data integrity across multiple databases (internal SAS, DB2, VSAM; external: Adobe, Excel, SAS parsing routines, COBOL). â€¢ Builds sophisticated statistical models and forecasting tools using these databases. â€¢ Defines and frames complex multi-dimensional healthcare issues and develops time tables/processes for decision making. â€¢ Translates needs, issues, and ideas into effective strategies and action plans. â€¢ Formulates specific implementation plans and evaluates the effectiveness of actions/programs implemented. â€¢ Develops creative alternative solutions. â€¢ Works closely with IT and outside partners (and physicians for TPMG departments). â€¢ May coordinate team/project activities and schedules. â€¢ May assist in the determination of goals and priorities with team, clients, or project management sponsors. â€¢ May provide leadership to multi-disciplinary project teams. â€¢ Communicates results/recommendations to project sponsors, clients, and various senior level audiences (including physicians for TPMG departments). Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum three (3) years of programming in SAS, SQL, VBA, .net or equivalent statistical analytical programming language. â€¢ Minimum of three (3) years of related analytical consulting experience. Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree in economics, finance, health care administration, public health administration, statistics, mathematics, operations research, or related field required OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. Licenses, Certifications, Registrations â€¢ N/A. Additional Requirements: â€¢ Broad familiarity with medical practices, especially population management and process and outcomes measurement. â€¢ Experience with MVS/TSO operating systems required â€¢ Experience with analytical manipulation and interpretation of large databases required. â€¢ Microsoft Office skills required. â€¢ Very strong analytic and critical thinking skills, writing skills, communication skills, consulting skills, and ability to work within a team. â€¢ Ability to express complex analytical and technical information to senior management or to audiences with clinical training. â€¢ Must be an independent self-starter. â€¢ Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment. Preferred Qualifications: â€¢ Master's degree preferred. â€¢ Analytical consulting experience in the healthcare field. â€¢ Knowledge of JCL strongly preferred. title: Business System Trainer Sr
requirement: Business System Trainer Sr(Job Number: 481433) As a member of Kaiser Permanente Colorado's team, you'll be proud of the contributions you make every day. The areas we serve offer something for everyone-historic districts, family neighborhoods, and access to some of the best ski resorts in the world. Prepare to be inspired. Description THIS POSTING REPRESENTS THREE POSITIONS Leads team members and communicates on all aspects of training and development. Identifies all training impacts resulting from project or seasonal enhancements with minimal direction from other project team members. Initiates training strategy proposals using in-depth level of understanding of the enterprise-wide medical functions and processes as well as current applications being used. Designs, develops, and conducts training and development programs for all medical professional users of the KP Health Connect system. Designs and develops training curriculum for classes and conducts related training classes. Recommends new modules for use of educational knowledge management tools and systems. Partners with operations leaders on classes for post training needs. Performs financial analyses of costs for staff training. Provides site support at any of Kaiser's medical offices with group training by departments and/or role. Performs analysis of departmental needs and recommends assessments including, end user proficiency assessments and related training classes directly to end user's management as well as develops all of the related training materials. Supports end user departments with the design, development and delivery of training for all system and business enhancements. Essential Functions: â€¢ Leads team members by initiating training plans to present to the end user community as it pertains to needs analysis/discoveries from departmental training classes and assessments. â€¢ Initiates new training strategies and methodologies for training to increase student's retention. â€¢ Mentors colleagues and shares subject matter expertise with no oversight and reports project/work status and issues to direct management and across functions. â€¢ Assists in staffing needs including; interviewing, making hiring recommendations, assigning work to meet objectives, tracking and reporting progress to superiors. â€¢ Analyzes departments and end user needs, designs and develops written, oral and computer based competency assessments, classes, web based training and job aids for new system modules and functionality. â€¢ Analyzes all system enhancements/changes and determines required modifications to existing system and business training materials. â€¢ Performs financial analysis to provide cost estimates to operations leaders for staff to be trained. â€¢ Designs and develops curriculum and conducts training programs using adult education strategy and tactics. â€¢ Identifies and specifies training objectives/competencies for education modules and classes. â€¢ Provides feedback for reviews. â€¢ Designs, develops, and revises training/education modules and materials including; outlines, scripts, train the trainer guides, web reference tools/courses, job aids and print-based instructional handouts. â€¢ Designs and develops computer based and experiential based training/education modules. â€¢ Leads work teams with no oversight. â€¢ Consults with leadership on department's and trainee's proficiency outcomes designed to enhance job performance. â€¢ Performs all duties with minimal to no oversight. Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree in education, psychology, business, sociology, health care or directly related field OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ N/A Additional Requirements: â€¢ Demonstrated experience leading small work teams. â€¢ Demonstrated knowledge of current adult education trends and techniques. â€¢ Demonstrated exceptional interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis on teaching and group facilitation. â€¢ Specialized knowledge of information systems, personal computers and experience with Windows based applications is required. â€¢ Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills required. Strong customer service skills required. Preferred Qualifications: â€¢ EPIC Systems software experience and certifications strongly preferred. title: Senior Environment Engineer
requirement: Senior Environment Engineer(Job Number: 482565) We're looking for big ideas-ideas that can embrace multiple petabytes of vital information. That's how much data we manage and store at Kaiser Permanente. We're home to some other big ideas, like creating KP HealthConnect, the nation's largest electronic medical record system, using social media and text messaging to help members engage in their own care, and developing predictive modeling tools that anticipate health issues before they're an issue. It's the kind of thinking that's shaping the future of technology, health care, and the lives of all of our members. If you're ready to contribute your own big ideas, join us. Description EES Environment Build Engineer SUMMARY The Enterprise Environment Services (EES) group provides expertise in technical planning, building, data de-identification, data sub-setting and supporting of application environments (including in-house and vendor developed applications), evaluating configurations and application architecture while assessing impact on KP platform environments; Supporting many mainframe and client-server systems, and Web-enabled technologies. This position for a SR Environment Build Engineer has a specific focus on Mainframe technology, yet will expand to include Distributed applications. DELIVERABLES IN FIRST 90 DAYS: 1) Become familiar with the overall application environment topology, interfaces, regularly occurring jobs, build plans, releases, and maintenance activities. 2) Understand EESâ€™ role in the environment build and support and how EES interact with the various KPIT organizations to complete technical deliverables. 3) Understand the Remedy service request process â€“ Work Orders, CRQs, and Incidents. 4) Assume primary role as the technical build engineer for all application environments required for De-identification and Membership Systems Releases. 5) Participate in daily or weekly scheduled meetings with management, project sponsors, and other technical teams to respond to project schedule updates, open issues, prioritization of activities, and resource planning. 6) Satisfy all mandatory internal training requirements. DELIVERABLES IN THE FIRST 120 DAYS 1) Independently provide analysis & technical solutions for overall application environment topology, interfaces, regularly occurring jobs, build plans, releases, and maintenance activities. 2) Become familiar with overall build engineer for all non-production Electronic Health Record & Medicare Systems. 3) Provide input to work and cost estimate for projects. 4) Participate in the build, validation, and troubleshooting as needed for application interfaces to other systems including DB2, Oracle, SQL and client server applications and messaging systems. 5) Prioritize, schedule, and coordinate all of the above activities across all EES resources supporting the non-production releases & data de-identification projects. 6) Work with application teams, technical or non-technical SMEs to gather and verify technical requirements for non-production environment builds and maintenance. DELIVERABLES FIRST YEAR 1) Complete delivery of all non-production environments for all Common Membership releases, Health Connect and Medicare Business Engine. 2) Independently prepare and execute project plans for environment builds and data operations. 3) Design processes, process improvements, and departmental standards for data de-identification, data sub setting, environment builds and support. RESPONSIBILITIES 1) Provide daily maintenance and technical support activities associated to the operations of pre-production environments (development, QA test, workflow integration, UAT, training and staging/production support). 2) Work with internal IT organizations and/or vendor to find resolution to system failures, and provide a root cause analysis. 3) Provide occasional 24x7 production support/coordination as assigned in an on-call rotation. 4) Map technical requirements to the application environment and infrastructure requirements, coordination of equipment sizing, acquisition and application environment build-out with infrastructure engineers, system administrators, and internal IT groups. 5) In addition to internal IT groups coordination with vendor supported applications is required to assess conformity with Kaiser Standards and determine fit into the target application architecture and perform environment operational testing. Monitor application performance and recommend performance improvements. 6) Knowledge of code migration services. 7) Contribute to project planning and scheduling, preparation of work effort estimates, and coordinate the execution of project build activities across multiple teams and individuals. Align project plans with the EES Environment Strategy. 8) Provides periodic informal work guidance/direction to, and training of team members. 9) Excellent communication skills for all levels of the organization. 10) Able to perform the highest complexity tasks, independent of close supervision and guidance. 11) Some off-hours and weekend work may be required. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum four (4) years of related experience. Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree in related field OR fourr (4) years equivalent experience. â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ N/A Additional Qualifications: 1) 6-8 years progressively complex experience working with infrastructure planning, design, and provisioning, application installation, configuration and support experience with DB2, BMC Utilities, COBOL, FILE AID, VSAM, JCL, TSO, CLISTS, REX, SQL, EGL, Unix & Linux (shell scripts, stfp), Windows server, Oracle 2) Working knowledge of software applications including but not limited to MS Project, MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, & MS Visio. 3) Flexible and quick to learn new technologies without the benefit of formal classroom training. 4) Excellent analytical skills and ability to effectively communicate with clients. Ability to work through alternative solutions and ideas with multiple departments and then present findings/ideas. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS: 1) Experience with Data de-identification software: Compuware Data Solutions 2) Experience with Data sub setting software: Informatica Test Data Management 3) Good Understanding of SDLC, Remedy, Quality Center 4) Full knowledge of healthcare industry practices 5) Knowledge of Government Health programs Primary Location: California-Pleasanton-Pleasanton Tech Cntr Building E 5820 Owens Dr. Scheduled Hours (1-40): 40 Shift: Day Working Days: Mon - Fri Working Hours Start: 8:00am Working Hours End: 5:00pm Schedule: Full-time Job Type: Standard Employee Status: Regular Employee Group (Union Affiliation): Salaried, Non-Union, Exempt Job Level: Individual Contributor Job: Information Technology Public Department Name: Enterprise Environment Services Travel: No Job Eligible for Benefits: Yes External hires must pass a background check/drug screen. title: Project Manager Lead - Claims Applications
requirement: Project Manager Lead - Claims Applications(Job Number: 441178) We're looking for big ideas-ideas that can embrace multiple petabytes of vital information. That's how much data we manage and store at Kaiser Permanente. We're home to some other big ideas, like creating KP HealthConnect, the nation's largest electronic medical record system, using social media and text messaging to help members engage in their own care, and developing predictive modeling tools that anticipate health issues before they're an issue. It's the kind of thinking that's shaping the future of technology, health care, and the lives of all of our members. If you're ready to contribute your own big ideas, join us. Description Kaiser Permanente is heavily investing in new capabilities to support Health Plan claims processing. These capabilities are supported by large complex multi-year IT projects. The KPIT HP Claims Sub-Portfolio seeks a PM Consultant Specialist to work as a thought partner with our business clients to ensure the successful delivery of these IT solutions. You will be joining a high performing motivated team of business and IT professionals eager to deliver outstanding solutions against aggressive timetables. As a PM Lead, you will have overall responsible to develop/define, publish and execute project plans to completion. You will own Statements of work (SOWs), work plans, schedules, budgets and overall deliverables. This individual identifies needed resources, defines roles and responsibilities and arranges for assignments of key project participants. Ongoing communications is critical including reporting of tasks, deliverables, budgets, and escalation of risks and issues. You will have responsibility for one or more projects or tracks within a program. RESPONSIBILITIES: Effectively manage and execute one or more projects or tracks within a program. Contribute to the ongoing improvement of the Claims Sub portfolio's project management capability through the development and improvement of processes and through sharing of best practices across the PM team. Define, develop and execute integrated project plan. Define and develop team structure and roles & responsibilities. Lead all phases of projects, from concept through deployment, including needs assessment, system requirements determination, TCO estimates, planning, scoping, scheduling, budgeting, development, testing, implementation, etc. Conduct business impact and cost/benefit analysis evaluations and recommend the appropriate course of action for assigned projects. Effectively communicate project status, recommend actions and determine priorities with the Business and IT stakeholders. Establish appropriate project control, processes, standards and procedures. Track internal and external vendor deliverables to ensure that they meet committed scope, schedule and budget. Positively influence project stakeholders, perform at a strategic and tactical/hands-on level, and provide communications and guidance to senior executives and sponsors regarding their role in ensuring the success of all assigned projects. Facilitate communications and interactions between functional groups, team members, strategic partners and vendors Develop key working relationships with team members from regional KPIT, business clients, and the Claims group. Effectively take on the leadership role of assigned projects. Qualifications BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: A BA/BS in any field or 4 years of equivalent years of experience A minimum of 6 years of Project Management experience A minimum of 6 years of experience in leading IT development and implementation of highly complex, large scale, multi-location, multi-year corporate IT initiatives. 4 - 6 years of experience in creating and maintaining integrated business and IT project plans with key milestones, dependencies, critical paths, and resource loaded. Excellent MS Project skills Excellent oral and written communications skills. Excellent problem solving and "decision making" skills. Demonstrated success working in a matrix team environment for a large organization Self-Motivated, Independent work capability Results orientation - Demonstrated ability to execute in a fast paced environment. title: HR Technology - Sr Project Manager
requirement: HR Technology - Sr Project Manager(Job Number: 483554) No matter what your job title, the work you do at Kaiser Permanente supports the health and well-being of the millions of men, women, and children who turn to us for care. That`s because all of us-from our talented corporate and business professionals to our care delivery experts who meet the needs of our members every day-are committed to providing the best possible care experience. With locations across the United States, we offer the opportunity to build a rewarding career in an environment that supports your success. Join us and put your beliefs into practice. Description Responsible for employing standard project management methods and techniques to ensure successful completion of technology related projects, including system upgrades or implementations. Projects can vary from small, short term projects through large, enterprise level projects across functional areas. Responsible for producing or managing the production of the entire portfolio of project deliverables, including project timelines, budget, task and issue tracking, etc. Engages clients and functional peer groups in information gathering/research, issue identification and management, and change management/acceptance. Essential Functions: â€¢ Project planning: Responsible for planning and conducting project kickoff meetings, defining project scope, facilitating technical/operational requirements identification, developing detailed project plans, project budget or anticipated savings, and establishing a framework for the management of on-going project activities. â€¢ Project execution and tracking: Manages the project management process, including leading project meetings. â€¢ May document issues, action items, user requirements, or deliverables from project meetings. â€¢ Performs a variety of project related activities, including: updating project schedules and plans, project communications, budget tracking, etc. â€¢ Accomplishes all work within established methodologies and standards. â€¢ Issues management: Identifies and tracks project issues, resolving issues where possible or escalating to higher management when needed. â€¢ Assesses and manages risks and drives mitigation activities. â€¢ Change management: Influences and gains commitment to change. â€¢ Partners with clients and project team members to drive communications and change management activities for each project deliverable. â€¢ May be responsible for participating in the development of communications and change management materials. â€¢ Business and process improvement: Identifies opportunities for business or process improvement; makes associated recommendations as appropriate. â€¢ Customer Service: Actively engages clients through all phases of the project life cycle, ensuring client satisfaction through timely communication and consistent completion of deliverables within communicated timeframes. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum five (5) years of experience with dedicated project management using industry standard project management tools and techniques. Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree, OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. License, Certification, Registration â€¢ N/A Additional Requirements: â€¢ Microsoft Project - project plan creation and maintenance and conceptualization of project components and deliverables. â€¢ Ability to facilitate project planning meetings to articulate project components and deliverables. â€¢ Must be able to work in a Labor/Management Partnership environment. title: Senior Project Manager - Pleasanton, CA
requirement: Senior Project Manager - Pleasanton, CA(Job Number: 465587) We're looking for big ideas-ideas that can embrace multiple petabytes of vital information. That's how much data we manage and store at Kaiser Permanente. We're home to some other big ideas, like creating KP HealthConnect, the nation's largest electronic medical record system, using social media and text messaging to help members engage in their own care, and developing predictive modeling tools that anticipate health issues before they're an issue. It's the kind of thinking that's shaping the future of technology, health care, and the lives of all of our members. If you're ready to contribute your own big ideas, join us. Description This is an excellent opportunity to join an IT team that is essential to manage complex IT initiatives across portfolio groups and technology disciplines. The NCAL BIO PMO supports the end-to-end delivery of business and technology solutions. The key focus of the PMO team is to lead our diverse teams of business partners and technology specialists to conceptualize, define, design, test, implement and support complex technology initiatives and applications. The Senior Project Manager will work closely with stakeholders and business clients to identify and deliver standard project outcomes and artifacts. Projects will typically involve multiple IT departments and may span multiple sites within and outside of the NCAL region. The Senior Project Manager will develop, publish, and execute project plans to completion, and will generally manage multiple concurrent tracks of work. This individual will own Statements of Work, work plans, schedules, budgets, and overall deliverables. This individual will identify needed resources, define roles and responsibilities, and arrange for assignment of project participants through partnership with various cross-functional groups. The Senior Project Manager is expected to communicate effectively with a broad range of stakeholders, both technical and non-technical. The individual must be able to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. The Senior Project Manager must be an effective facilitator to work through issues, to negotiate agreements across various stakeholder groups, and to build team relationships across organizational lines. Essential Functions: Â· Manage moderately complex projects or multiple projects Â· Define, develop, maintain and execute integrated project plan appropriately scoped to requirements and budget Â· Ensure the project deliverables are technically sound, clearly defined, obtainable and decomposed to a manageable level Â· Develop framework and manage the tracking of interdependencies within or across projects Â· Manage coordination across multiple stakeholders from both IT and Business to ensure project objectives are met Â· Lead all phases of projects, from concept through deployment, including needs assessment, system requirements determination, scheduling, testing, implementation, etc. Â· Define estimated delivery time, budgets required, and resources needed for the successful completion of projects Â· Project scope includes internally, externally and ASP supported applications. Â· Manage budgets and project financials Â· Effectively communicate project status and critical path, recommend actions and determine priorities with the Business and IT stakeholders Â· Assist the team in resolving problems, developing solutions, vendor selection, and minimizing technical barriers to the business plan. Â· Understand and apply knowledge of and best practices for change management process on projects Â· Track internal and external vendor deliverables to ensure that they meet committed scope, schedule, and budget Â· Manage project issues/risks and resolution; escalate as needed Â· Define risk mitigation strategy and develop viable contingency plans. Â· Prepare content for and make appropriate presentations Â· Develop and execute a communication plan, including identifying stakeholders, appropriate communication channels, and key messages Â· Ensure quality criteria are met before software is distributed. Â· Facilitate communications and interactions between functional groups, team members, strategic partners and vendors Â· Provide accurate time reporting for managed projects and reconcile on a monthly basis with your budget and schedule Â· Generate monthly status reports including project health and quality Â· Contribute to the ongoing improvement of the portfolio's project management capability through participation in the development and improvement of processes Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Experience â€¢ Minimum four (4) years of experience. Education â€¢ Bachelor's degree in a related field OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field. â€¢ High School Diploma or General Education Development (GED) required. Preferred Qualifications: Â· Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or equivalent experience Â· 3 years of senior project management including IT full life cycle project planning (i.e. requirements gathering, cost analysis, gap and risk planning, design, QA testing, implementation and change control). Â· 3 years of experience managing projects in a large-scale environment Â· Excellent team work & collaboration skills, strong customer services focus, and excellent interpersonal skills. The ASG Supplier Management organization develops, implements, and manages supplier strategies with emphasis on quality, cost containment, and customer service. This position is responsible for working with both our offshore suppliers and internal stakeholders to ensure that the outsource engagements are functioning optimally in accordance with the contract. The Supplier Manager is responsible for assisting with the management of large IT contracts with strategic outsource suppliers. Primary areas of responsibility include supplier and stakeholder engagement, contract negotiations and management, contract renewals, contract change request process, benchmarking, scorecard development and management, and overall supplier performance in an outsourced environment. Consult with IT teams on the construction and ongoing maintenance of their offshore supplier contracts. Help develop strategic solutions that assist KP in optimizing our use of suppliers providing IT services. Analyze, and manage to resolution, supplier issues escalated by KPIT teams.
